tool.name: Confusion Matrix Statistics
tool.help:
**Confusion Matrix Statistics**
Statistics similar to what R is showing when running the Naive Bayes Testing algorithm.
**Output**
Output example: [{ "result": [{ "type": "application/vnd.highcharts+json", "data": { "Class name: AD": { "F1": 0.418604651163, "Pos Pred Value": 0.80303030303, "Prevalence": 0.366666666667, "Recall": 0.215189873418, "Sensitivity": 0.246575342466, "Precision": 0.929889298893, "Neg Pred Value": 0.911660777385, "Balanced Accuracy": 0.773006134969, "Specificity": 0.129411764706, "Detection Prevalence": 0.82428115016, "Detection Rate": 0.56183745583 }, "overall": { "AccuracyUpper": 0.580928811167, "Kappa": 0.0800609108947, "McnemarPValue": 5.27068778867e-10, "AccuracyNull": 0.556179775281, "AccuracyPValue": 0.868570075967, "AccuracyLower": 0.47477998336, "Positive Class": "", "Accuracy": 0.52808988764 }, "Class name: CN": { "F1": 0.129411764706, "Pos Pred Value": 0.418604651163, "Prevalence": 0.80303030303, "Recall": 0.246575342466, "Sensitivity": 0.773006134969, "Precision": 0.56183745583, "Neg Pred Value": 0.366666666667, "Balanced Accuracy": 0.661122661123,
